member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IDocument
member.summary: An object that represents a document. This can be either source or binary or designer surface etc

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IDocument.Location
member.summary: The location where this document was found, or where it should be stored. This will also uniquely identify the source document within an instance of compilation host.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IDocument.Name
member.summary: The name of the document. For example the name of the file if the document corresponds to a file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IGenericTypeParameter
member.summary: The definition of a type parameter of a generic type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IGenericParameter
member.summary: The definition of a type parameter of a generic type or method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IGenericParameterReference
member.summary: A reference to the definition of a type parameter of a generic type or method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterListEntry
member.summary: Implemented by an entity that is always a member of a particular parameter list, such as an IParameterDefinition. Provides a way to determine the position where the entity appears in the parameter list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterListEntry.Index
member.summary: The position in the parameter list where this instance can be found.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IGenericParameter.Constraints
member.summary: A list of classes or interfaces. All type arguments matching this parameter must be derived from all of the classes and implement all of the interfaces.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IGenericParameter.MustBeReferenceType
member.summary: True if all type arguments matching this parameter are constrained to be reference types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IGenericParameter.MustBeValueType
member.summary: True if all type arguments matching this parameter are constrained to be value types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IGenericParameter.MustHaveDefaultConstructor
member.summary: True if all type arguments matching this parameter are constrained to be value types or concrete classes with visible default constructors.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IGenericParameter.Variance
member.summary: Indicates if the generic type or method with this type parameter is co-, contra-, or non variant with respect to this type parameter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IGenericTypeParameterReference
member.summary: A reference to a type parameter of a generic type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IGenericTypeParameterReference.DefiningType
member.summary: A reference to the generic type that defines the referenced type parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IGenericTypeParameter.DefiningType
member.summary: The generic type that defines this type parameter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention
member.summary: Specifies how the callee passes parameters to the callee and who cleans up the stack.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.C
member.summary: C/C++ style calling convention for unmanaged methods. The call stack is cleaned up by the caller, which makes this convention suitable for calling methods that accept extra arguments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.Default
member.summary: The convention for calling managed methods with a fixed number of arguments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.ExtraArguments
member.summary: The convention for calling managed methods that accept extra arguments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.FastCall
member.summary: Arguments are passed in registers when possible. This calling convention is not yet supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.Standard
member.summary: Win32 API calling convention for calling unmanged methods via PlatformInvoke. The call stack is cleaned up by the callee.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.ThisCall
member.summary: C++ member unmanaged method (non-vararg) calling convention. The callee cleans the stack and the this pointer is pushed on the stack last.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.Generic
member.summary: The convention for calling a generic method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.HasThis
member.summary: The convention for calling an instance method with an implicit this parameter (the method does not have an explicit parameter definition for this).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.ExplicitThis
member.summary: The convention for calling an instance method that explicitly declares its first parameter to correspond to the this instance.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IEventDefinition
member.summary: An event is a member that enables an object or class to provide notifications. Clients can attach executable code for events by supplying event handlers. This interface models the metadata representation of an event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IEventDefinition.Accessors
member.summary: A list of methods that are associated with the event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IEventDefinition.Adder
member.summary: The method used to add a handler to the event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IEventDefinition.Caller
member.summary: The method used to call the event handlers when the event occurs. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IEventDefinition.IsRuntimeSpecial
member.summary: True if the event gets special treatment from the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IEventDefinition.IsSpecialName
member.summary: This event is special in some way, as specified by the name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IEventDefinition.Remover
member.summary: The method used to add a handler to the event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IEventDefinition.Type
member.summary: The (delegate) type of the handlers that will handle the event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.HandlerKind
member.summary: The kind of handler for the SEH

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.HandlerKind.Catch
member.summary: Handler is for Catch

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.HandlerKind.Filter
member.summary: Handler is filter

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.HandlerKind.Finally
member.summary: Handler is finally

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.HandlerKind.Fault
member.summary: Handler is Fault

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody
member.summary: A metadata (IL) level represetation of the body of a method or of a property/event accessor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IDoubleDispatcher. The dispatch method does not invoke Dispatch on any child objects. If child traversal is desired, the implementations of the Visit methods should do the subsequent dispatching.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody.OperationExceptionInformation
member.summary: A list exception data within the method body IL.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody.LocalsAreZeroed
member.summary: True if the locals are initialized by zeroeing the stack upon method entry.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody.LocalVariables
member.summary: The local variables of the method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody.MethodDefinition
member.summary: The definition of the method whose body this is. If this is the body of an event or property accessor, this will hold the corresponding adder/remover/setter or getter method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody.MaxStack
member.summary: The maximum number of elements on the evaluation stack during the execution of the method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody.PrivateHelperTypes
member.summary: Any types that are implicitly defined in order to implement the body semantics. In case of AST to instructions conversion this lists the types produced. In case of instructions to AST decompilation this should ideally be list of all types which are local to method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition
member.summary: This interface models the metadata representation of a method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodReference
member.summary: A reference to a method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISignature
member.summary: The parameters and return type that makes up a method or property signature. This interface models the metadata representation of a signature.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISignature.GetParameters(System.Object)
member.summary: The parameters forming part of this signature.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISignature.GetType(System.Object)
member.summary: The return type of the method or type of the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISignature.CallingConvention
member.summary: Calling convention of the signature.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISignature.ParameterCount
member.summary: The number of required parameters of the signature.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISignature.ReturnValueCustomModifiers
member.summary: Returns the list of custom modifiers, if any, associated with the returned value. Evaluate this property only if ReturnValueIsModified is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISignature.ReturnValueIsByRef
member.summary: True if the return value is passed by reference (using a managed pointer).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISignature.ReturnValueIsModified
member.summary: True if the return value has one or more custom modifiers associated with it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodReference.GetResolvedMethod(System.Object)
member.summary: The method being referred to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodReference.AcceptsExtraArguments
member.summary: True if the call sites that references the method with this object supply extra arguments.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodReference.GenericParameterCount
member.summary: The number of generic parameters of the method. Zero if the referenced method is not generic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodReference.IsGeneric
member.summary: True if the method has generic parameters;

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodReference.ExtraParameters
member.summary: Information about this types of the extra arguments supplied at the call sites that references the method with this object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.GetBody(System.Object)
member.summary: A container for a list of IL instructions providing the implementation (if any) of this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.GenericParameters
member.summary: If the method is generic then this list contains the type parameters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.HasDeclarativeSecurity
member.summary: True if this method has a non empty collection of SecurityAttributes or the System.Security.SuppressUnmanagedCodeSecurityAttribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsAbstract
member.summary: True if the method does not provide an implementation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsAccessCheckedOnOverride
member.summary: True if the method can only be overridden when it is also accessible.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsConstructor
member.summary: True if the method is a constructor.

members.member:
True if the method has an external implementation (i.e. not supplied by this definition).
IsPlatformInvoke || IsRuntimeInternal || IsRuntimeImplemented

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsForwardReference
member.summary: True if the method implementation is defined by another method definition (to be supplied at a later time).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsHiddenBySignature
member.summary: True if this method is hidden if a derived type declares a method with the same name and signature. If false, any method with the same name hides this method. This flag is ignored by the runtime and is only used by compilers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsNativeCode
member.summary: True if the method is implemented in native (platform-specific) code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsNewSlot
member.summary: The method always gets a new slot in the virtual method table. This means the method will hide (not override) a base type method with the same name and signature.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsNeverInlined
member.summary: True if the the runtime is not allowed to inline this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsNeverOptimized
member.summary: True if the runtime is not allowed to optimize this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsPlatformInvoke
member.summary: True if the method is implemented via the invocation of an underlying platform method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsRuntimeImplemented
member.summary: True if the implementation of this method is supplied by the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsRuntimeInternal
member.summary: True if the method is an internal part of the runtime and must be called in a special way.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsRuntimeSpecial
member.summary: True if the method gets special treatment from the runtime. For example, it might be a constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsSealed
member.summary: True if the method may not be overridden.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsSpecialName
member.summary: True if the method is special in some way for tools. For example, it might be a property getter or setter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsStatic
member.summary: True if the method does not require an instance of its declaring type as its first argument.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsSynchronized
member.summary: True if only one thread at a time may execute this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsVirtual
member.summary: True if the method may be overridden (or if it is an override).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsUnmanaged
member.summary: True if the implementation of this method is not managed by the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.Parameters
member.summary: The parameters forming part of this signature.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.PreserveSignature
member.summary: True if the method signature must not be mangled during the interoperation with COM code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.PlatformInvokeData
member.summary: Detailed information about the PInvoke stub. Identifies which method to call, which module has the method and the calling convention among other things.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.RequiresSecurityObject
member.summary: True if the method calls another method containing security code. If this flag is set, the method should have System.Security.DynamicSecurityMethodAttribute present in its list of custom attributes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.ReturnValueAttributes
member.summary: Custom attributes associated with the method's return value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.ReturnValueIsMarshalledExplicitly
member.summary: The return value has associated marshalling information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.ReturnValueMarshallingInformation
member.summary: Specifies how the return value is marshalled when the method is called from unmanaged code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.SecurityAttributes
member.summary: Declarative security actions for this method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterDefinition
member.summary: This interface models the metadata representation of a method or property parameter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterTypeInformation
member.summary: Information that describes a method or property parameter, but does not include all the information in a IParameterDefinition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterTypeInformation.GetType(System.Object)
member.summary: The type of argument value that corresponds to this parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterTypeInformation.CustomModifiers
member.summary: The list of custom modifiers, if any, associated with the parameter. Evaluate this property only if IsModified is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterTypeInformation.IsByReference
member.summary: True if the parameter is passed by reference (using a managed pointer).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterTypeInformation.IsModified
member.summary: This parameter has one or more custom modifiers associated with it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterDefinition.ParamArrayElementType(System.Object)
member.summary: The element type of the parameter array. ^ requires this.IsParameterArray;

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterDefinition.DefaultValue
member.summary: A compile time constant value that should be supplied as the corresponding argument value by callers that do not explicitly specify an argument value for this parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterDefinition.HasDefaultValue
member.summary: True if the parameter has a default value that should be supplied as the argument value by a caller for which the argument value has not been explicitly specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterDefinition.IsIn
member.summary: True if the argument value must be included in the marshalled arguments passed to a remote callee.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterDefinition.IsMarshalledExplicitly
member.summary: This parameter has associated marshalling information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterDefinition.IsOptional
member.summary: True if the argument value must be included in the marshalled arguments passed to a remote callee only if it is different from the default value (if there is one).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterDefinition.IsOut
member.summary: True if the final value assigned to the parameter will be marshalled with the return values passed back from a remote callee.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterDefinition.IsParameterArray
member.summary: True if the parameter has the ParamArrayAttribute custom attribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IParameterDefinition.MarshallingInformation
member.summary: Specifies how this parameter is marshalled when it is accessed from unmanaged code.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IPropertyDefinition
member.summary: A property is a member that provides access to an attribute of an object or a class. This interface models the metadata representation of a property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPropertyDefinition.Accessors
member.summary: A list of methods that are associated with the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPropertyDefinition.DefaultValue
member.summary: A compile time constant value that provides the default value for the property. (Who uses this and why?)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPropertyDefinition.Getter
member.summary: The method used to get the value of this property. May be absent (null).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPropertyDefinition.HasDefaultValue
member.summary: True if this property has a compile time constant associated with that serves as a default value for the property. (Who uses this and why?)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPropertyDefinition.IsRuntimeSpecial
member.summary: True if this property gets special treatment from the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPropertyDefinition.IsSpecialName
member.summary: True if this property is special in some way, as specified by the name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPropertyDefinition.Parameters
member.summary: The parameters forming part of this signature.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedEventDefinition
member.summary: Represents the specialized event definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedEventDefinition.UnspecializedVersion
member.summary: The event that has been specialized to obtain this event. When the containing type is an instance of type which is itself a specialized member (i.e. it is a nested type of a generic type instance), then the unspecialized member refers to a member from the unspecialized containing type. (I.e. the unspecialized member always corresponds to a definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedFieldReference
member.summary: Represents reference specialized field.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedFieldReference.UnspecializedVersion
member.summary: A reference to the field definition that has been specialized to obtain the field definition referred to by this field reference. When the containing type of the referenced specialized field definition is itself a specialized nested type of a generic type instance, then the unspecialized field reference refers to the corresponding field definition from the unspecialized containing type definition. (I.e. the unspecialized field reference always refers to a field definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedMethodReference
member.summary: Represents reference specialized method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedMethodReference.UnspecializedVersion
member.summary: A reference to the method definition that has been specialized to obtain the method definition referred to by this method reference. When the containing type of the referenced specialized method definition is itself a specialized nested type of a generic type instance, then the unspecialized method reference refers to the corresponding method definition from the unspecialized containing type definition. (I.e. the unspecialized method reference always refers to a method definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedPropertyDefinition
member.summary: Represents the specialized property definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedPropertyDefinition.UnspecializedVersion
member.summary: The property that has been specialized to obtain this property. When the containing type is an instance of type which is itself a specialized member (i.e. it is a nested type of a generic type instance), then the unspecialized member refers to a member from the unspecialized containing type. (I.e. the unspecialized member always corresponds to a definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction
member.summary: Enum specifying the kinds of security actions

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.ActionNil
member.summary: No Security Action.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.Request
member.summary: Specify the security requried to run.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.Demand
member.summary: Check that all callers in the call chain have been granted specified permissions, all of which derive from System.Security.Permissions.CodeAccessPermission.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.Assert
member.summary: Without further checks, satisfy Demand for the specified permissions, all of which derive from System.Security.Permissions.CodeAccessPermission.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.Deny
member.summary: Without further checks refuse Demand for the specified permissions, all of which derive from System.Security.Permissions.CodeAccessPermission.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.PermitOnly
member.summary: Without further checks, refuse Demand for all permissions other than those specified, all of which derive from System.Security.Permissions.CodeAccessPermission.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.LinkDemand
member.summary: Check that immediate caller has been granted the specified permissions, all of which derive from System.Security.Permissions.CodeAccessPermission.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.InheritanceDemand
member.summary: Check that all derived classes have been granted the specified permissions, all of which derive from System.Security.Permissions.CodeAccessPermission.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.RequestMinimum
member.summary: Specify the minimum permissions required to run.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.RequestOptional
member.summary: Specify the optional permissions to grant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.RequestRefuse
member.summary: Specify the permissions not to be granted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.PrejitGrant
member.summary: Reserved for implementation specific use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.PrejitDenied
member.summary: Reserved for implementation specific use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.NonCasDemand
member.summary: Check that all callers in the call chain have been granted the specified permissions, none of which derive from System.Security.Permissions.CodeAccessPermission.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.NonCasLinkDemand
member.summary: Check that the immediate caller has been granted the specified permissions, none of which derive from System.Security.Permissions.CodeAccessPermission.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAction.NonCasInheritance
member.summary: Check that all derived classes have been granted the specified permissions, none of which derive from System.Security.Permissions.CodeAccessPermission.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISecurityAttribute
member.summary: A declarative specification of a security action applied to a set of permissions. Used by the CLR loader to enforce security restrictions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISecurityAttribute.Action
member.summary: Specifies the security action that can be performed using declarative security. For example the action could be Deny.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISecurityAttribute.Attributes
member.summary: Custom attributes that collectively define the permission set to which the action is applied. Each attribute represents a serialized permission or permission set. The union of the sets, together with the individual permissions, define the set to which the action applies.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.CustomMarshaller
member.summary: A reference to the type implementing the custom marshaller.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.CustomMarshallerRuntimeArgument
member.summary: An argument string (cookie) passed to the custom marshaller at run time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.ElementSize
member.summary: The size of an element of the fixed sized umanaged array.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.ElementSizeMultiplier
member.summary: A multiplier that must be applied to the value of the parameter specified by ParamIndex in order to work out the total size of the unmanaged array.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.ElementType
member.summary: The unmanged element type of the unmanaged array.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.IidParameterIndex
member.summary: Specifies the index of the parameter that contains the value of the Inteface Identifier (IID) of the marshalled object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.UnmanagedType
member.summary: The unmanaged type to which the managed type will be marshalled. This can be be UnmanagedType.CustomMarshaler, in which case the unmanaged type is decided at runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.NumberOfElements
member.summary: The number of elements in the fixed size portion of the unmanaged array.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.ParamIndex
member.summary: The zero based index of the parameter in the unmanaged method that contains the number of elements in the variable portion of unmanaged array. If the index is null, the variable portion is of size zero, or the caller conveys the size of the variable portion of the array to the unmanaged method in some other way.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.SafeArrayElementSubtype
member.summary: The type to which the variant values of all elements of the safe array must belong. See also SafeArrayElementUserDefinedSubtype. (The element type of a safe array is VARIANT. The "sub type" specifies the value of all of the tag fields (vt) of the element values. )

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.SafeArrayElementUserDefinedSubtype
member.summary: A reference to the user defined type to which the variant values of all elements of the safe array must belong. (The element type of a safe array is VARIANT. The tag fields will all be either VT_DISPATCH or VT_UNKNOWN or VT_RECORD. The "user defined sub type" specifies the type of value the ppdispVal/ppunkVal/pvRecord fields of the element values may point to.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IName

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IName.UniqueKey
member.summary: An integer that is unique within the pool from which the name instance has been allocated. Useful as a hashtable key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IName.UniqueKeyIgnoringCase
member.summary: An integer that is unique within the pool from which the name instance has been allocated. Useful as a hashtable key. All name instances in the pool that have the same string value when ignoring the case of the characters in the string will have the same key value.

member.summary: Return zero or more locations in primary source documents that correspond to one or more of the given derived (non primary) document locations.
member.param: Zero or more locations in documents that have been derived from one or more source documents.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocationProvider.GetSourceNameFor(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalDefinition,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Returns the source name of the given local definition, if this is available. Otherwise returns the value of the Name property and sets isCompilerGenerated to true.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider.GetLocalScopes(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local (block) scopes into which the CLR IL operations in the given method body is organized.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider.GetNamespaceScopes(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns zero or more namespace scopes into which the namespace type containing the given method body has been nested. These scopes determine how simple names are looked up inside the method body. There is a separate scope for each dotted component in the namespace type name. For istance namespace type x.y.z will have two namespace scopes, the first is for the x and the second is for the y.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider.GetIteratorScopes(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local (block) scopes, each defining an IL range in which an iterator local is defined. The scopes are returned by the MoveNext method of the object returned by the iterator method. The index of the scope corresponds to the index of the local. Specifically local scope i corresponds to the local stored in field <localName>x_i of the class used to store the local values in between calls to MoveNext.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider.GetConstantsInScope(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScope)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local constant definitions that are local to the given scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider.GetVariablesInScope(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScope)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local variable definitions that are local to the given scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider.IsIterator(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns true if the method body is an iterator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.GetDefiningUnitReference(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference,System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a reference to the unit that defines the given referenced type. If the referenced type is a structural type, such as a pointer or a generic type instance, then the result is null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.TypesAreEquivalent(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference,Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Returns true if the given two types are to be considered equivalent for the purpose of signature matching and so on.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation
member.summary: A range of source text that corresponds to an identifiable entity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation.Contains(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: True if the source at the given location is completely contained by the source at this location.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation.CopyTo(System.Int32,System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the specified number of characters to the destination character array, starting at the specified offset from the start if the source location. Returns the number of characters actually copied. This number will be greater than zero as long as position is less than this.Length. The number will be precisely the number asked for unless there are not enough characters left in the document.
member.param: The starting index to copy from. Must be greater than zero and less than this.Length.
The destination array. Must have at least destinationOffset+length elements.
The starting index where the characters must be copied to in the destination array.
The maximum number of characters to copy.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation.EndIndex
member.summary: The character index after the last character of this location, when treating the source document as a single string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation.Length
member.summary: The number of characters in this source location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation.SourceDocument
member.summary: The document containing the source text of which this location is a subrange.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation.Source
member.summary: The source text corresponding to this location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation.StartIndex
member.summary: The character index of the first character of this location, when treating the source document as a single string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument
member.summary: An object that represents a source document, such as a text file containing C# source code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument.CopyTo(System.Int32,System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies no more than the specified number of characters to the destination character array, starting at the specified position in the source document. Returns the actual number of characters that were copied. This number will be greater than zero as long as position is less than this.Length. The number will be precisely the number asked for unless there are not enough characters left in the document.
member.param: The starting index to copy from. Must be greater than or equal to zero and position+length must be less than or equal to this.Length;
The destination array.
The starting index where the characters must be copied to in the destination array.
The maximum number of characters to copy. Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to the number elements of the destination array.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument.GetCorrespondingSourceLocation(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: Returns a source location in this document that corresponds to the given source location from a previous version of this document.

member.summary: Obtains a source location instance that corresponds to the substring of the document specified by the given start position and length.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceDocument.ToLineColumn(System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Maps the given (zero based) source position to a (one based) line and column, by scanning the source character by character, counting new lines until the given source position is reached. The source position and corresponding line+column are remembered and scanning carries on where it left off when this routine is called next. If the given position precedes the last given position, scanning restarts from the start. Optimal use of this method requires the client to sort calls in order of position.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceDocument.DocumentType
member.summary: A Guid that identifies the kind of document to applications such as a debugger. Typically System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymDocumentType.Text.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceDocument.Language
member.summary: A Guid that identifies the programming language used in the source document. Typically used by a debugger to locate language specific logic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceDocument.LanguageVendor
member.summary: A Guid that identifies the compiler vendor programming language used in the source document. Typically used by a debugger to locate vendor specific logic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceDocument.PrimarySourceLocation
member.summary: A source location corresponding to the entire document.

member.summary: A possible empty list of upper bounds for dimension indices. The first upper bound in the list corresponds to the first dimension. Dimensions cannot be skipped. An unspecified upper bound means that instances of this type can have an arbitrary upper bound for that dimension.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ICustomModifier.Modifier

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedNestedTypeReference

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedNestedTypeReference.UnspecializedVersion
member.summary: A reference to the nested type that has been specialized to obtain this nested type reference. When the containing type is an instance of type which is itself a specialized member (i.e. it is a nested type of a generic type instance), then the unspecialized member refers to a member from the unspecialized containing type. (I.e. the unspecialized member always corresponds to a definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodImplementation

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodImplementation.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IDefinition. The dispatch method does not invoke Dispatch on any child objects. If child traversal is desired, the implementations of the Visit methods should do the subsequent dispatching.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TypeMemberVisibility.Default
member.summary: The visibility has not been specified. Use the applicable default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TypeMemberVisibility.Assembly
member.summary: The member is visible only within its own assembly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TypeMemberVisibility.Family
member.summary: The member is visible only within its own type and any subtypes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TypeMemberVisibility.FamilyAndAssembly
member.summary: The member is visible only within the intersection of its family (its own type and any subtypes) and assembly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TypeMemberVisibility.FamilyOrAssembly
member.summary: The member is visible only within the union of its family and assembly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TypeMemberVisibility.Other
member.summary: The member is visible only to the compiler producing its assembly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TypeMemberVisibility.Private
member.summary: The member is visible only within its own type.

member.summary: The member is visible everywhere its declaring type is visible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TypeMemberVisibility.Mask

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.TypeParameterVariance

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TypeParameterVariance.NonVariant
member.summary: Two type or method instances are compatible only if they have exactly the same type argument for this parameter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TypeParameterVariance.Covariant
member.summary: A type or method instance will match another instance if it has a type for this parameter that is the same or a subtype of the type the other instance has for this parameter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TypeParameterVariance.Contravariant
member.summary: A type or method instance will match another instance if it has a type for this parameter that is the same or a supertype of the type the other instance has for this parameter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.TypeParameterVariance.Mask
member.summary: A mask that can be used to mask out flag bits when the latter are stored in the same memory word as the enumeration.

member.summary: A reference to a .NET module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModuleReference.ContainingAssembly
member.summary: The Assembly that contains this module. May be null if the module is not part of an assembly.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.GetStrings
member.summary: Returns zero or more strings used in the module. If the module is produced by reading in a CLR PE file, then this will be the contents of the user string heap. If the module is produced some other way, the method may return an empty enumeration or an enumeration that is a subset of the strings actually used in the module. The main purpose of this method is to provide a way to control the order of strings in a prefix of the user string heap when writing out a module as a PE file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.GetAllTypes
member.summary: Returns all of the types defined in the current module. These are always named types, in other words: INamespaceTypeDefinition or INestedTypeDefinition instances.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.AssemblyReferences
member.summary: A list of the assemblies that are referenced by this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.BaseAddress
member.summary: The preferred memory address at which the module is to be loaded at runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.ContainingAssembly
member.summary: The Assembly that contains this module. If this module is main module then this returns this.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.DllCharacteristics
member.summary: Flags that control the behavior of the target operating system. CLI implementations are supposed to ignore this, but some operating system pay attention.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.EntryPoint
member.summary: The method that will be called to start execution of this executable module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.FileAlignment
member.summary: The alignment of sections in the module's image file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.ILOnly
member.summary: True if the module contains only IL and is processor independent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.Kind
member.summary: The kind of metadata stored in this module. For example whether this module is an executable or a manifest resource file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.LinkerMajorVersion
member.summary: The first part of a two part version number indicating the version of the linker that produced this module. For example, the 8 in 8.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.LinkerMinorVersion
member.summary: The first part of a two part version number indicating the version of the linker that produced this module. For example, the 0 in 8.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.MetadataFormatMajorVersion
member.summary: The first part of a two part version number indicating the version of the format used to persist this module. For example, the 1 in 1.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.MetadataFormatMinorVersion
member.summary: The second part of a two part version number indicating the version of the format used to persist this module. For example, the 0 in 1.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.ModuleAttributes
member.summary: A list of objects representing persisted instances of types that extend System.Attribute. Provides an extensible way to associate metadata with this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.ModuleName
member.summary: The name of the module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.ModuleReferences
member.summary: A list of the modules that are referenced by this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.PersistentIdentifier
member.summary: A globally unique persistent identifier for this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.RequiresAmdInstructionSet
member.summary: If set, the module contains instructions or assumptions that are specific to the AMD 64 bit instruction set. Setting this flag to true also sets Requires64bits to true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.Requires32bits
member.summary: If set, the module contains instructions that assume a 32 bit instruction set. For example it may depend on an address being 32 bits. This may be true even if the module contains only IL instructions because of PlatformInvoke and COM interop.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.Requires64bits
member.summary: If set, the module contains instructions that assume a 64 bit instruction set. For example it may depend on an address being 64 bits. This may be true even if the module contains only IL instructions because of PlatformInvoke and COM interop.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.SizeOfHeapCommit
member.summary: The size of the virtual memory initially committed for the initial process heap.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.SizeOfHeapReserve
member.summary: The size of the virtual memory to reserve for the initial process heap.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.SizeOfStackCommit
member.summary: The size of the virtual memory initially committed for the initial thread's stack.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.SizeOfStackReserve
member.summary: The size of the virtual memory to reserve for the initial thread's stack.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.TargetRuntimeVersion
member.summary: Identifies the version of the CLR that is required to load this module or assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.TrackDebugData
member.summary: True if the instructions in this module must be compiled in such a way that the debugging experience is not compromised. To set the value of this property, add an instance of System.Diagnostics.DebuggableAttribute to the MetadataAttributes list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IModule.Win32Resources
member.summary: A list of named byte sequences persisted with the module and used during execution, typically via the Win32 API. A module will define Win32 resources rather than "managed" resources mainly to present metadata to legacy tools and not typically use the data in its own code.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IAssemblyReference
member.summary: A reference to a .NET assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IAssemblyReference.Culture
member.summary: Identifies the culture associated with the assembly reference. Typically specified for sattelite assemblies with localized resources. Empty or null if not specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IAssemblyReference.IsRetargetable
member.summary: True if the implementation of the referenced assembly used at runtime is not expected to match the version seen at compile time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IAssemblyReference.PublicKeyToken
member.summary: The hashed 8 bytes of the public key of the referenced assembly. This is empty or null if the referenced assembly does not have a public key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IAssemblyReference.Version
member.summary: The version of the assembly reference. Null means Version(0, 0, 0, 0).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IAssemblyReference.Location
member.summary: Full path to assembly file or null if not specified.
member.remarks: The location is available when full path to the reference was provided in addition to an assembly name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IAssembly.AssemblyAttributes
member.summary: A list of objects representing persisted instances of types that extend System.Attribute. Provides an extensible way to associate metadata with this assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IAssembly.ExportedTypes
member.summary: Public types defined in other modules making up this assembly and to which other assemblies may refer to via this assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IAssembly.Files
member.summary: A list of the files that constitute the assembly. These are not the source language files that may have been used to compile the assembly, but the files that contain constituent modules of a multi-module assembly as well as any external resources. It corresonds to the File table of the .NET assembly file format.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IAssembly.Flags
member.summary: A set of bits and bit ranges representing properties of the assembly. The value of can be set from source code via the AssemblyFlags assembly custom attribute. The interpretation of the property depends on the target platform.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IAssembly.PublicKey
member.summary: The public part of the key used to encrypt the SHA1 hash over the persisted form of this assembly. Empty or null if not specified. This value is used by the loader to decrypt an encrypted hash value stored in the assembly, which it then compares with a freshly computed hash value in order to verify the integrity of the assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IAssembly.Resources
member.summary: A list of named byte sequences persisted with the assembly and used during execution, typically via .NET Framework helper classes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IAssembly.SecurityAttributes
member.summary: A list of objects representing persisted instances of pairs of security actions and sets of security permissions. These apply by default to every method reachable from the module.

member.name: T:Roslyn.Compilers.RuntimeMembers.MemberDescriptor
member.summary: Structure that describes a member of a type.

member.name: F:Roslyn.Compilers.RuntimeMembers.MemberDescriptor.DeclaringTypeId
member.summary:
Id/token of containing type, usually value from some enum. For example from SpecialType enum. I am not using SpecialType as the type for this field because VB runtime types are not part of SpecialType.
So, the implication is that any type ids we use outside of the SpecialType (either for the VB runtime classes, or types like System.Task etc.) will need to use IDs that are all mutually disjoint.

member.name: F:Roslyn.Compilers.RuntimeMembers.MemberDescriptor.Signature
member.summary: Signature of the field or method, similar to metadata signature, but with the following exceptions: 1) Trancated on the left, for methods starts at [ParamCount], for fields at [Type] 2) Type tokens are not compressed 3) BOOLEAN | CHAR | I1 | U1 | I2 | U2 | I4 | U4 | I8 | U8 | R4 | R8 | I | U | Void types are encoded by using VALUETYPE+typeId notation. 4) array bounds are not included. 5) modifiers are not included. 6) (CLASS | VALUETYPE) are omitted after GENERICINST

member.name: T:Roslyn.Compilers.RuntimeMembers.SignatureComparer`4
member.summary: Helper class to match signatures in format of MemberDescriptor.Signature to members.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.RuntimeMembers.SignatureComparer`4.MatchFieldSignature(`1,Roslyn.Compilers.ReadOnlyArray{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns true if signature matches signature of the field. Signature should be in format described in MemberDescriptor.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.RuntimeMembers.SignatureComparer`4.MatchPropertySignature(`2,Roslyn.Compilers.ReadOnlyArray{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns true if signature matches signature of the property. Signature should be in format described in MemberDescriptor.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.RuntimeMembers.SignatureComparer`4.MatchMethodSignature(`0,Roslyn.Compilers.ReadOnlyArray{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns true if signature matches signature of the method. Signature should be in format described in MemberDescriptor.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.RuntimeMembers.SignatureComparer`4.MatchType(`3,Roslyn.Compilers.ReadOnlyArray{System.Int32},System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Does pretty much the same thing as MetadataDecoder.DecodeType only instead of producing a type symbol it compares encoded type to the target.
Signature should be in format described in MemberDescriptor.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.RuntimeMembers.SignatureComparer`4.GetGenericTypeArgument(`3,System.Int32)
member.summary: Should return null in case of error.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.RuntimeMembers.SignatureComparer`4.GetGenericTypeDefinition(`3)
member.summary: Should return null in case of error.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.RuntimeMembers.SignatureComparer`4.GetPointedToType(`3)
member.summary: Should only accept Pointer types. Should return null in case of error.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.RuntimeMembers.SignatureComparer`4.GetSZArrayElementType(`3)
member.summary: Should return null in case of error.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.RuntimeMembers.SignatureComparer`4.MatchArrayRank(`3,System.Int32)
member.summary: Should only accept multi-dimansional arrays.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.RuntimeMembers.SignatureComparer`4.GetArrayElementType(`3)
member.summary: Should only accept multi-dimansional arrays. Should return null in case of error.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.TextSpan.OverlapsWith(Roslyn.Compilers.TextSpan)
member.summary: Determines whether overlaps this span. Two spans are considered to overlap if they have positions in common and neither is empty. Empty spans do not overlap with any other span.
member.param: The span to check.
member.returns: true if the spans overlap, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.TextSpan.Overlap(Roslyn.Compilers.TextSpan)
member.summary: Returns the overlap with the given span, or null if there is no overlap.
member.param: The span to check.
member.returns: The overlap of the spans, or null if the overlap is empty.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.TextSpan.IntersectsWith(Roslyn.Compilers.TextSpan)
member.summary: Determines whether intersects this span. Two spans are considered to intersect if they have positions in common or the end of one span coincides with the start of the other span.
member.param: The span to check.
member.returns: true if the spans intersect, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.TextSpan.IntersectsWith(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether intersects this span. A position is considered to intersect if it is between the start and end positions (inclusive) of this span.
member.param: The position to check.
member.returns: true if the position intersects, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.TextSpan.Intersection(Roslyn.Compilers.TextSpan)
member.summary: Returns the intersection with the given span, or null if there is no intersection.
member.param: The span to check.
member.returns: The intersection of the spans, or null if the intersection is empty.

member.summary: Converts to with all metadata fields filled.
member.returns: Assembly name with Version, Culture and PublicKeyToken components filled in: "SimpleName, Version=#.#.#.#, Culture=XXX, PublicKeyToken=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX". In addition Retargetable flag is set.

member.summary: Converts to an equivalent .

member.summary: Creates object by parsing given display name.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.AssemblyIdentity.CreateName(System.String,System.Version,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Byte[],System.Reflection.AssemblyNameFlags,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an assembly name whose FullName has at least Version, Culture and PublicKeyToken properties: "SimpleName, Version=#.#.#.#, Culture=XXX, PublicKeyToken=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX".
member.remarks:
Note that names AssemblyName { Name = "Foo", Version = new Version(1.2.3.4), Culture = CultureInfo.Invariant, PublicKeyToken = new byte[0] } and AssemblyName { Name = "Foo", Version = new Version(1.2.3.4), Culture = CultureInfo.Invariant, PublicKeyToken = null },
AssemblyName { Name = "Foo", Version = new Version(1.2.3.4), Culture = CultureInfo.Invariant, PublicKeyToken = new[] { ... } } and AssemblyName { Name = "Foo", Version = new Version(1.2.3.4), Culture = null, PublicKeyToken = new[] { ... } },
AssemblyName { Name = "Foo", Version = new Version(1.2.3.4), Culture = CultureInfo.Invariant, PublicKeyToken = new[] { ... } } and AssemblyName { Name = "Foo", Version = null, Culture = CultureInfo.Invariant, PublicKeyToken = new[] { ... } },
are in general considered different.
Also Version("0.0") != Version("0.0.0.0"), etc.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.AssemblyIdentity.TriviallyEquivalent(System.Reflection.AssemblyName,System.Reflection.AssemblyName)
member.summary: Returns true (false) if specified assembly names are (not) equal regardless of unification or retargeting policies. Returns null if these policies must be consulted to determine name equivalence.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Compilers.AssemblyIdentity.PropertiesEqual(System.Reflection.AssemblyName,System.Reflection.AssemblyName)
member.summary: Compares Version, Culture, PublicKeyToken and Flags properties of specified assembly names for exact equality. Binding policies (version unification) are not considered.
